{"step_by_step_thinking": "KCNT2 is a gene that encodes a sodium-activated potassium channel. Mutations in this gene have been associated with various neurological disorders, including epilepsy. However, it's not accurate to say that mutations in KCNT2 only cause phenotypes with epilepsy. Other neurological disorders or symptoms could also potentially be associated with mutations in this gene.", "answer_choice": "B"}
